section.title: Mathematical Markup Language (&MML;)
section.para: There is a strong relationship to the MathML recommendation MathML_98 from the Worldwide Web Consortium, and a large overlap between the two developer communities. MathML deals principally with the presentation of mathematical objects, while &OM; is solely concerned with their semantic meaning or content. While MathML does have some limited facilities for dealing with content, it also allows semantic information encoded in &OM; to be embedded inside a MathML structure. Thus the two technologies may be seen as highly complementary.

section.title: &MML; Presentation of &OM;
section.para: &MML; Presentation is the recommended technology for rendering &OM; on computer screens. There are several possibilities for associating presentation &MML; to &OM;.
